description:
Ren Amamiya is about to enter his second year after transferring to Shujin Academy in Tokyo.
Following a particular incident, his Persona awakens, and together with his friends they form the “Phantom Thieves of Hearts” to reform hearts of corrupt adults by stealing the source of their distorted desires.
Meanwhile, bizarre and inexplicable crimes have been popping up one after another…
Living an ordinary high school life in Tokyo during the day, the group maneuvers the metropolitan city as Phantom Thieves after hours.
Let the curtain rise for this grand, picaresque story!

(Source: Official website)
synonyms: ペルソナ5アニメーション

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

node.description: ATLUS (株式会社アトラス Kabushiki-gaisha Atorasu) is a Japanese computer and video game developer, publisher, and distributor based in Tokyo, Japan, best known for developing the role-playing video game franchise Megami Tensei and the surgical simulation/visual novel franchise Trauma Center.  (Source: Wikipedia)
Currently works at Atlus. Main character designer for Persona 3 onwards.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/795583350)

Currently a freelancer with deep ties to [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

He is close friends with [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/猪爪慎一)

Music composer of many Atlus videogame titles, he joined the company in 1995.

He left Atlus in September of 2021.

edges.role: Theme Song Composition (OP1, OP2, ED1, ED2, ED3, ED4)

node.description:
__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/lynsoulsinger/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Lyn_Inaizumi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lyn_inaizumi/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/InaizumiLyn/videos) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Musician-Band/Lyn-Inaizumi-%E7%A8%B2%E6%B3%89-%E3%82%8A%E3%82%93-363872070841120/)__

__Lyn Inaizumi__, better known by stage name Lyn, is a Japanese musician and vocalist, best known for her appearance in the video game soundtrack for Persona 5, composed by [Shoji Meguro](https://anilist.co/staff/103958/Shouji-Meguro).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/heichin26)

Kazuho Hyoudou is a Japanese anime screenwriter and light novel writer. Currently a freelancer. He graduated from the Department of Film and Visual Arts in Osaka University of Arts. He previously worked as a production manager at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise). Later debuting as a screenwriter on [Shutsugeki! Machine Robo Rescue](https://anilist.co/anime/3098/Shutsugeki-Machine-Robo-Rescue/) in 2003. Since then, he has written scripts for several anime series. His more recent notable works include [Tonikaku Kawaii](https://anilist.co/anime/116267/TONIKAWA-Over-The-Moon-For-You/) and [ReLIFE](https://anilist.co/anime/21049/ReLIFE/)

He has also worked as a scenario writer on the Xenoblade Chronicles series of video games by [Nintendo](https://anilist.co/staff/280450/Nintendo)

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenoblade Chronicles X (Video Game, 2015) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (Video Game, 2017) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (Video Game, 2022) (Scenario)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村暢)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pvoluc5tt6djvvc)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/猪爪慎一)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/795583350)

He is close friends with [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).
